title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spelman College
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview. There were three people from the department on the zoom call. Each went around and asked questions from a sheet. They were pretty standard questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you are the best candidate for this position? Where do you used yourself in 5 years?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Spelman College
Interview Descriptions: I went through 2 rounds of interviews and took an exam (Microsoft, PowerPoint, Word) exam. The interviews lasted an hour each. The exam wasn’t too difficult but did take some hours.
Interview Questions: Tell us more about your experience

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to the position and received a phone call to interview within 48 hours. The interview with HR was great as she was very knowledgeable and fun to talk to. 

However, the talk with the hiring manager was a different story. We spent very little time talking about the job I applied for and almost exclusively about large job responsibilities that weren't in the job description. I had I known about the actual job responsibilities, I wouldn't have applied to the position. 

I felt like they were trying to milk ideas they could use in their position from me more than anything else.
Interview Questions: How do I stay on task and make sure my deadlines are met?

title: Community Service Interview
Interview Descriptions: Went through a PROFESSIONAL agency. Staff was very helpful and pay offered was fair. Degree is necessary for the position. All requirements were explained in detail. I met with the hiring manager and she was very helpful. I remained calm, by being myself. Try not to think too much about the process.

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called in. Interview team was professional and pleasant. Campus was beautiful and clean. Met HR rep before interviewing and was walked over to interview location.

title: Resident Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: Very unprofessional. I shouldn't have ignored the red flags during my interview process. Phone interview, skype interview, and on campus interview. They emailed me within two days to set up a phone interview. They didn't fully answer the questions I had towards the end of the interview and I felt like they were hiding something from me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. Tell me about something that's not on your resume.

title: Administrative Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview then in person group interview. Interviewers came across as jealous, so, if you're attractive, don't bother applying here! (sad but true)  The interviewers had basic questions that they had printed off the internet and could barely read the questions!!

title: Development Officer Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Spelman College
Interview Descriptions: Spelman is a very professional work place and it showed in the interview process. Everyone was vey kind and welcoming, but very professional. There were no typical personality assessment questions or curve balls like "What book are you reading?" or "What is your greatest weakness?" All questions focused on experience and capacity to do the job. The whole process was very quick, less than a month between application and job offer. Everyone I interacted with was vey pleasant and respectful.
Interview Questions: How do you organize your time?

title: Resident Advisor/Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Spelman College (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: There are two interviews, one with the director of the program and the other with a department head. The interview for the RA position was focused on behavioral questions, while the department head was interested in your academic expertise or success in their department.

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions: All day interview typical for academics. Remember however you are treated once you are employed they won't be as solicitous (the honeymoon phase is completed) and you will be on your own.
Interview Questions: I don't remember but the interview process is pleasant they court you but not as much as PWI's. You have to get back and forth to airport in a taxi and they do not go out to dinner with you on your first night.

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a behavioral interview as well as a review of qualifying grades in all mathematics courses taken.  The environment was comfortable and relaxed.  Questions were asked about previous experience and performance in past required courses.  There were also questions pertaining to methods of tutoring.
Interview Questions: What methods would you use/attitude would you have when trying to help a student who is having trouble grasping important material.

title: Fundraising Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
Two rounds with several people. Half a day process each day. Very different personalities in the groups so questions go from one end of the spectrum to the other.
The process allows you to get a big picture of the FR arm and how it all works together. How the personalities blend, etc. Everyone seemed to be open about their experiences if you let them talk long enough.
Interview Questions: General questions about FR experience, working with alumnae groups, etc

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied through a staffing agency. An extensive interview with the hiring manager two weeks after submitting application.

A week following the interview, I followed up with the staffing agency. Staffing agency informed me via email that Spelman chose me for the position. After spending another 7-10 days to confirm a start date, the staffing agency emailed me at the end of the day to inform me that the institution decided not to proceed citing "pedagogy" as the excuse. Made no sense, I spent years as a classroom teacher and I had experience in instructional design and e-Learning. There was no requirement that the Instructional Designer had to have experience actually instructing the content he/she would be developing... 

BTW, the interview took place October 2014; I FINALLY received formal communication from Spelman in the form of a rejection letter March 2015. Not a good look for an institution that prides itself on its reputation...
Interview Questions:
Questions about experience in Public Education and Corporate Learning and Development.  Detailed questions regarding design methods and development tools used for various projects. 
Submitted work samples.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Spelman College (Atlanta, GA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was standard questions.  Tell me about yourself.  Why do you want to work here?  Why should we chose you?  What do you know about the college?
Interview Questions: What do I know about their department?
